problem_text:
(P. Cameron). Let G be a finite primitive permutation group and suppose that the stabilizer Gα of a point α induces on some of its orbits ∆̸= {α} a regular permutation group. Is it true that |Gα| = |∆|?
A. N. Fomin
answer: No, not always (P. Spiga, J. Group Theory, 25, no. 1 (2022), 113–126).
